It is very useful to put some con=
currency pressure on your code.  This
doesn't guarantee that it's threadsaf=
e but it gives you a reasonable
idea.

FYI, here is how it works in TestNG:=


@Test(invocationCount =3D 1000, threadPoolSize =3D 5, timeOut =3D 10000)
=
public void f() { ... }

This will invoke f() a thousand times from five di=
fferent threads.
Any invocation that doesn't return within 10 seconds will =
be marked as
a failure.

You can also specify timeout and thread pool size =
at the system level
and TestNG will run all your tests from the thread pool=
 you specified.
